availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Manville Webster (Newport, Campbell Co atty)

body.p: Newport, Kentucky attorney. New York native. Married Anna E. Webster. Father of S. Nazarine Webster, Kate Webster, and Anna Webster. Held two slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 44. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 880. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 240. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 1. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 184. “Francis Manville Webster,” Find A Grave, September 5, 2012, memorial no. 96562228 (accessed April 18, 2017).
